required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immunobridging Study of 9-valent Human Papillomavirus Recombinant Vaccine in Chinese Females Aged 9 to 19 Years
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Immunogenicity and Safety of 9-valent Human Papillomavirus(Type6, 11, 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52 and 58) Recombinant Vaccine in Chinese Females Aged 9 to 45 Years: A Phase 3, Open-label, Non-randomised Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This phase 3 study will evaluate the immunogenicity and safety of 9-valent HPV recombinant vaccine in Chinese females aged 9 to 45 years

detailed_description.textblock: This study (protocol 9-HPV-3003) is an immunogenicity and safety study in the subjects (9-19 years of age) who received the 9-valent HPV recombinant vaccine compared with the subjects (20-45 years of age). In this study, we will assess whether the immunogenicity of the 9-valent HPV vaccine given 3-dose schedule in the subjects (9-19 years of age) in noninferior to that in the subjects (20-45 years of age) receiving 3 doses, while assessing the safety of this vaccine.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days after the last dose(3 doses schedule)
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome measure for assessing vaccine immunogenicity, among subjects aged between 9 and 45, is the results of seroconversion rate of neutralizing antibodies after immunization in pre-immune negative subjects from 30 days after the last dose (3 doses schedule, Month 7) to HPV 6, 11, 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52 , and 58.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with postive antibodies after the whole schedule vaccination from the former negative subjects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days after the last dose(3 doses schedule)
secondary_outcome.description: The secondary outcome measure for assessing vaccine immunogenicity, among subjects aged between 9 and 45, is the geometric mean titer (GMT) from 30 days after the last dose (3 doses schedule, Month 7) to HPV 6, 11, 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52 , and 58.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of seroconversion among the patient aged 9-26 after the whole schedule vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days after the last dose(3 doses schedule)
secondary_outcome.description: To assess vaccine immunogenicity among the subjects aged between 9 and 26, is the seroconversion rate of neutralizing antibodies and the GMT from 30 days after the last dose (3 doses schedule, Month 7) to HPV 6, 11, 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52 , and 58.

secondary_outcome.measure: GMT and seropositive rate of HPV in the 9-19 age group after 60-month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: After receiving all 3 doses vaccinations, the subjects aged 9 to 19 years will be followed for 60 month (Month 12/24/36/48/60) after first vaccination to assess the GMT and seropositive rate (4-fold-increase) to HPV 6, 11, 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58.

other_outcome.measure: Number of AE within 30 minutes after each dose
other_outcome.description: Adverse events reported within 30 minutes after each dose

other_outcome.measure: Number of SAE within 7days after each dose
other_outcome.time_frame: day 0 to day 7 after each dose
other_outcome.description: Solicited adverse events reported between day 0 to day 7 after each dose

other_outcome.measure: Number of unsolicited adverse events within 30days after each dose
other_outcome.time_frame: day 0 to day 30 after each dose
other_outcome.description: Unsolicited adverse events reported between day 0 to day 30 after each dose

other_outcome.measure: Number of all SAE during the study period
other_outcome.time_frame: Stage 1: from month 6 to month 12 after the last dose; Stage 2: 6 month after receiving the whole vaccine schedule to 60 month after the 1st dose
other_outcome.description: Serious adverse events reported during the study period

other_outcome.measure: Number and rate of pregnancy events
other_outcome.time_frame: Stage 1: from month 6 to month 12 after the last dose; Stage 2: 9-to-19-year-old subjects received 3 doses vaccinations, 6 month after receiving the whole vaccine schedule to 60 month after the 1st dose
other_outcome.description: Pregnant event and pregnant outcome reported during the study period

arm_group.description: 9-valent HPV recombinant vaccine (Hansenula Polymorpha) All subjects aged 9 to 45 years received 3 doses of 9v HPV vaccine at 0,2,6 month scehdule

intervention.description: 9-valent HPV recombinant vaccine (Hansenula Polymorpha) All subjects aged 9 to 45 years received 3 doses of 9v HPV vaccine at 0,2,6 month scehdule

overall_official.last_name: Person(s) responsible for the overall scientific leadership of Lv
overall_official.affiliation: Zhejiang Provincial Center for Disease Control and Prevention
